Notes on magnetism - II

Magnetic ions in crystals

Posted on October 6, 2022, by Yuanpeng Zhang

Talking about the magnetism of ions in crystals naturally brings us out of the atomic physics picture which we previously based ourselves in when discussing the free atom and ions (see previous note by clicking me!). Also, for sure we should turn to the many-electron scheme instead of a single-electron... [Read More]
Tags: solid state physics magnetism

Notes on magnetism - I

Magnetism of free atoms and ions

Posted on October 6, 2022, by Yuanpeng Zhang

To understand the magnetism of free atoms and ions, we may go through several stages, as follows, Hartree approximation - electrons are treated in a non-interactive manner. Beyond Hartree - interaction between electrons is taken into account. Spin-orbital coupling. Hyperfine interaction - the interaction between electrons and nucleus. [Read More]
Tags: solid state physics magnetism
